title: Thunderbird Beta and Release: External GnuPG Keys Not Working with GnuPG 2.5.x
creator: Th.Barghahn
content:
DEUTSCH (English see below(:

Hallo zudammen,

Konfiguration: - Window11 25H2 (aktuell) - Thunderbird Beta-6 (BuildID=20260213180051) - gpg2.5.17 (Gpg4Win 5.0.1); siehe auch: <https://www.gpg4win.de/>

Der bisherige und standarmärige Installationspfad von "Gpg4Win": "C:\Progam Diles (x86)\Gpg4Win\" wurde softwareseitig auf: "C:\Progam Diles\Gpg4Win\" geändert!

Bug 1967121 (Closed) => thunderbird148 --- fixed! <https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1967121>

Zur Zeit verfolge ich die Änderungen bezüglich der externen Schlüsselverwaltung in Thunderbird-Beta, da das Arbeiten mit externen Schlüsseln in der esr- und in der relesease-Version von Thunderbird seit der offiziellen Herausgabe von gpg2.5.x absolut nicht mehr möglich ist! Die geheimen Schlüssel für das Entschlüsseln und Signieren werden mit gpg2.5.x nicht mehr gefunden!

In der Schlüsselverwaltung von TB-Beta befinden sich meine öffentlichen Schlüssel und alle öffentlichen Schlüssel meiner Kommunikationspartner. Extern sind meine geheimen Schlüssel gelagert. Folgende Präferenz wurde aufgrund von gpg2.5.x hinzugefügt:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2026-02-26-10-04-58-df59be.png

Allerdings erscheint nach all diesen Maßnahmen die Fehlermeldung: "The secret key that's required to decrypt this message is not availlable."

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2026-02-26-10-05-45-d8280e.png

Mit Herausgabe von Thunderbird/148.0 (release) sind dort die gleichen Probleme mit der externen Schlüsselverwaltung zu bepbachten!

Mit Versionen gpg < 2.5 funktioniert unter Windows alles problemlos!

UNTER LINUX haben hier Änderungen an der Präferenz: "mail.openpgp.load_untested_gpgme_version" nachweislich keinerlei Auswirkungen!

Was übersehe ich?

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

ENGLISH:

Hello,

Configuration: - Window11 25H2 (current status) - Thunderbird Beta-6 (BuildID=20260213180051) - gpg2.5.17 (Gpg4Win 5.0.1); see also: <https://www.gpg4win.de/>

The previous and default installation path of "Gpg4Win": "C:\Program Files (x86)\Gpg4Win\" has been changed by the software to: "C:\Program Files\Gpg4Win\"!

Bug 1967121 (Closed) => thunderbird148 --- fixed! <https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1967121>

At the moment, I’m following the changes regarding external key management in Thunderbird Beta, because working with external keys in the ESR and release versions of Thunderbird has become absolutely impossible since the official release of gpg 2.5.x! The secret keys required for decryption and signing are no longer found when using gpg 2.5.x!

In Thunderbird Beta’s key manager, my public keys and all public keys of my communication partners are present. My secret keys are stored externally. The following preference was added because of gpg 2.5.x:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2026-02-26-10-04-58-df59be.png

However, even after all these measures, the following error message appears: **"The secret key that's required to decrypt this message is not available."**

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2026-02-26-10-05-45-d8280e.png

With the release of Thunderbird 148.0 (release), the same problems with external key management can be observed there as well!

With gpg versions **older than 2.5**, everything works flawlessly under Windows!

    • UNDER LINUX**, changes to the preference

"mail.openpgp.load_untested_gpgme_version" have demonstrably no effect at all!

What am I missing?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/145.0.0.0;tb_version:148 b6 Beta;os:Windows 11

title: Duplicate email messages downloading to both my mailboxes
creator: shaya4
content:
I have 2 email accounts. One is a Yahoo.com address and the other is an AT&T.net address. I have always been able to access both email accounts in my Thunderbird application on my computer (Windows 11). All Yahoo emails have always gone to my Yahoo mailbox and all AT&T emails go to my AT&T mailbox on Thunderbird. However, something happened this morning (a Yahoo popup popped up when I clicked on Thunderbird and I stupidly clicked on accept) and now I'm getting duplicate emails in both accounts. After I clicked on accept on the Yahoo popup, all my emails from all folders (inbox, trash, spam) from the AT&T server downloaded into my Yahoo mailbox (in Thunderbird) and were deleted from my AT&T server from myyahoo.com (not on Thunderbird). Is there anyway to reverse this or change something in the Thunderbird application so I can go back to what it was previously (all Yahoo mail goes to my Yahoo.com mailbox and all AT&T mail goes to my AT&T.net mailbox in Thunderbird)?

I have contacted Yahoo and AT&T about this and after spending most of the day on the phone with each of them, they informed me that since my mail provider (Thunderbird) is a third party application, I would have to contact Thunderbird.

Please help! 

Andrea

title: Trouble with adding a second Gmail account in Thunderbird
creator: ddrandall06
content:
I am trying to add a business gmail account to my Thunderbird on Desktop and have run into difficulty.

I tried to use This Article in order to overcome the issue, however it is dated 2018 and seems very out of date with the current UI. So I am struggling with how to rename the incoming/outgoing servers to allow the new gmail account into the host.

When I try to add the gmail account I get the window to sign into the new account, but when I click continue I get "The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know." (see attached image).

Escaping out of the log in screen brings me back to the config page which appears to have accepted the account, until I hit continue and then it tells me that the incoming server is already in use. (see the second image).

I also tried turning off the experimental add account and use the previous interface to work the problem. I got the same results both times.

Please advise, I'd really like to have access to the account emails on my desktop without using the google web interface.

Thank you DD Randall

title: Thunderbird version 140.8.0esr (32-bit) - Cannot Send Email Suddenly
creator: timothychan
content:
My Thunderbird version 140.8.0esr (32-bit) started to refuse sending mails this morning.

The error message suggested to change the authentication method or if it still not working, my password could be stolen.

I tried changing authentication method, it did not solved the problem so I changed it back to original setting as seen in the picture.

I was afraid my account was hacked. I tried to send messages from my email account via other platform (the Web Mail service from the hosting company) and via my Android phone, mails sent successfully. So, my email account is safe.

Since it is my business email account, I have been using it on Thunderbird daily for decades and I never encountered this problem before. Problem just started this morning.

I tried to create a new Outgoing SMTP with same setting and deleted the old one, it didn't help.

Although my Thunderbird refuse to send out mails, it receives incoming mails as usual.

Hope someone can figure out this problem and help!

Thanks in advance.

Tim
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages"]

title: One Local Folder Saved on C: Is Inexplicably Huge
creator: larrybreese
content:
Hello all:

After migrating to a new machine I finally have TB set up and running nicely. As I checked the individual settings and C: folders for the e-mail accounts under the server settings for each account (there are two, law and business), and the local folders (for long term e-mail storage, under Local Folders, Local Directory settings), I discovered the C: folder for the Law e-mail account is gigantic - when I check the properties in File Explorer it comes back as 331 GIG, yes, gig. More disturbing is that most of this appears to be "dark matter" that does not "show up." I total the visible files and folders inside that location and it is roughly 150 meg.

For comparison, the folder directory for Business e-mail account is only 24.9 gig, and the directory for the local folder for long term e-mail storage only clocks in at 11.1 gig.

Any ideas why the law firm e-mail account C: drive storage would be this large, with so much of it not visible?

Thanks for any thoughts.

Larry Reese

title: Thunderbird – Unable to Send Emails | Request for Technical Support
creator: info13604
content: Dear Support Team, I am writing to request assistance with an issue I am experiencing with Mozilla Thunderbird. today Thunderbird is no longer able to send outgoing emails. Incoming emails work correctly, but when I try to send a message, it fails and the email remains in the Outbox. I have already checked the following: Internet connection is working correctly Account credentials are correct SMTP settings appear unchanged The issue persists after restarting the application Could you please help me identify the cause of this problem and advise on how to resolve it? If you need any additional information (error messages, server settings, logs, screenshots), please let me know and I will provide them. Thank you in advance for your support. Kind regards,
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10

title: Updates causing problems
creator: ke4avb
content:
Why does every time TB updates it cause all my Yahoo accounts force me to get new passwords? Is it TB or Yahoo that is creating this problem of me having jump through hoops just to get the accounts working again. BTW the passwords in TB don't work when this happens.

Either this get resolved or I stop updating TB.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:148.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/148.0;os:Windows 10/11

title: Problemi creazione account con POP
creator: frasaldi
content: Buongiorno, ho installato l'ultima versione di Thunderbird. Nel creare un nuovo account la procedura non mi consente di scegliere come tipo server POP ma mi inserisce in automatico il tipo server IMAP. Come posso risolvere, grazie
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;tb_version:148

title: Yahoo page pops up everytime I open Thunderbird, with a server time out box.
creator: andrew_black1
content:
Hi all,

everytime I open Thunderbird I get a popup window from Yahoo finance with a server timeout message. I am unable to connect to get my emails through. I need to log on directly to Yahoo mail, which is a pain.

Hopefully someone can help me with this.

Find attached the popup image.

Regards

title: dubbele mail
creator: thschuitemaker
content: Goede middag, ik gebruik Thunderbird al jaren met 2 verschillende mailaccounts. Woensdag heb ik een update gedaan naar versie 148.0. Hierna kreeg het 2e account dezelfde map structuur als het 1e account en alle mails uit account 1 staan nu ook in account 2. Heeft u hier een oplossing voor? Alvast bedankt. Theo Schuitemaker.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:148.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/148.0;tb_version:148.0 64bit;os:Windows 10/11
